% TABLE: Classification Performance Across Datasets (Table 7-9)

\begin{table*}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{Classification Performance Across Three EEG Datasets}
\label{tab:classification_all}
\begin{tabular}{lcccccccccc}

\textbf{Dataset} & \textbf{Role} & \textbf{Acc.} & \textbf{Prec.} & \textbf{Recall} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{Spec.} & \textbf{AUC} & \textbf{BA} & \textbf{$\kappa$} & \textbf{MCC} \\

DEAP & Benchmark & 94.7\% & 94.6\% & 94.0\% & 94.3\% & 95.4\% & 96.7\% & 94.5\% & 0.894 & 0.894 \\
SAM-40 & Primary & 93.2\% & 93.1\% & 92.5\% & 92.8\% & 93.7\% & 95.8\% & 93.1\% & 0.864 & 0.865 \\
EEGMAT & Validation & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 100.0\% & 1.000 & 1.000 \\
\midrule
\textbf{Average} & -- & \textbf{95.97\%} & \textbf{95.90\%} & \textbf{95.50\%} & \textbf{95.70\%} & \textbf{96.37\%} & \textbf{97.50\%} & \textbf{95.87\%} & \textbf{0.919} & \textbf{0.920} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{Acc = Accuracy, Prec = Precision, Spec = Specificity, BA = Balanced Accuracy, $\kappa$ = Cohen's Kappa, MCC = Matthews Correlation Coefficient}
\end{table*}

\label{tab:band_power}

& Delta & 0.5--4 & 11.8 $\pm$ 2.1 & 13.5 $\pm$ 2.4 & +0.38 & 0.0045 & ** \\
& Theta & 4--8 & 7.9 $\pm$ 1.8 & 10.8 $\pm$ 2.2 & +0.62 & 0.0002 & *** \\
& Alpha & 8--13 & 17.2 $\pm$ 3.2 & 11.8 $\pm$ 2.8 & $-$0.82 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Beta & 13--30 & 5.8 $\pm$ 1.4 & 9.2 $\pm$ 1.8 & +0.71 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Gamma & 30--45 & 1.9 $\pm$ 0.6 & 3.1 $\pm$ 0.8 & +0.48 & 0.0112 & * \\

& Delta & 0.5--4 & 12.5 $\pm$ 2.3 & 14.2 $\pm$ 2.6 & +0.42 & 0.0023 & ** \\
& Theta & 4--8 & 8.3 $\pm$ 1.9 & 11.7 $\pm$ 2.4 & +0.68 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Alpha & 8--13 & 18.6 $\pm$ 3.5 & 12.4 $\pm$ 3.0 & $-$0.89 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Beta & 13--30 & 6.2 $\pm$ 1.5 & 9.8 $\pm$ 1.9 & +0.74 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Gamma & 30--45 & 2.1 $\pm$ 0.7 & 3.4 $\pm$ 0.9 & +0.51 & 0.0089 & ** \\

& Delta & 0.5--4 & 13.1 $\pm$ 2.5 & 14.8 $\pm$ 2.8 & +0.35 & 0.0067 & ** \\
& Theta & 4--8 & 8.7 $\pm$ 2.0 & 11.2 $\pm$ 2.3 & +0.55 & 0.0008 & *** \\
& Alpha & 8--13 & 16.4 $\pm$ 3.1 & 11.2 $\pm$ 2.7 & $-$0.75 & 0.0001 & *** \\
& Beta & 13--30 & 6.5 $\pm$ 1.6 & 9.1 $\pm$ 2.0 & +0.58 & 0.0004 & *** \\
& Gamma & 30--45 & 2.3 $\pm$ 0.7 & 3.2 $\pm$ 0.9 & +0.41 & 0.0145 & * \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{Significance: * $p < 0.05$, ** $p < 0.01$, *** $p < 0.001$. Power values in $\mu V^2/Hz$.}
\end{table*}

% TABLE: Frontal Alpha Asymmetry (Table 19)
% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
\begin{table}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{Frontal Alpha Asymmetry (FAA) Analysis}
\label{tab:faa}
\begin{tabular}{lccccl}
\toprule
\textbf{Dataset} & \textbf{Baseline} & \textbf{Stress} & \textbf{$\Delta$FAA} & \textbf{$p$-value} & \textbf{Interpretation} \\
\midrule
DEAP & +0.08 & $-$0.18 & $-$0.26 & 0.0001 & Right dominance \\
SAM-40 & +0.12 & $-$0.15 & $-$0.27 & 0.0002 & Right dominance \\
EEGMAT & +0.10 & $-$0.12 & $-$0.22 & 0.0008 & Right dominance \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{FAA = ln(Right Alpha) $-$ ln(Left Alpha). Negative shift indicates stress-related right hemisphere activation.}
\end{table}

% TABLE: Baseline Comparison (Table 5)
% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
\begin{table}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{Comparison with Baseline Methods (SAM-40 Dataset)}
\label{tab:baselines}
\begin{tabular}{lccc}
\toprule
\textbf{Method} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{F1 Score} & \textbf{AUC-ROC} \\
\midrule
SVM (RBF) & 74.8\% & 87.0\% & 65.0\% \\
Random Forest & 76.2\% & 86.0\% & 70.0\% \\
XGBoost & 77.5\% & 86.0\% & 72.0\% \\
CNN & 78.3\% & 86.0\% & 74.0\% \\
LSTM & 79.1\% & 87.0\% & 75.0\% \\
CNN-LSTM & 80.2\% & 87.0\% & 76.0\% \\
EEGNet & 79.8\% & 87.0\% & 75.0\% \\
DGCNN & 80.6\% & 87.0\% & 77.0\% \\
\midrule
\textbf{GenAI-RAG-EEG} & \textbf{93.2\%} & \textbf{92.8\%} & \textbf{95.8\%} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{Improvement over best baseline (DGCNN): +12.6\% accuracy, +5.8\% F1, +18.8\% AUC.}
\end{table}

% TABLE: Ablation Study (Table 6)
% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
\begin{table}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{Ablation Study Results}
\label{tab:ablation}
\begin{tabular}{lcc}
\toprule
\textbf{Model Variant} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Acc.} \\
\midrule
Full Model & 93.2\% & -- \\
$-$ Text Encoder & 91.5\% & $-$1.7\% \\
$-$ Self-Attention & 91.1\% & $-$2.1\% \\
$-$ Bi-LSTM & 89.6\% & $-$3.6\% \\
$-$ RAG Module & 93.0\% & $-$0.2\% \\
CNN Baseline & 89.6\% & $-$3.6\% \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{Bi-LSTM contributes most to performance. RAG provides explainability without accuracy improvement.}
\end{table}

% TABLE: Cross-Dataset Transfer (Table 10)
% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
\begin{table}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{Cross-Dataset Transfer Learning Results}
\label{tab:cross_dataset}
\begin{tabular}{llccc}
\toprule
\textbf{Source} & \textbf{Target} & \textbf{Accuracy} & \textbf{F1} & \textbf{$\Delta$ Acc.} \\
\midrule
SAM-40 & DEAP & 71.4\% & 70.8\% & $-$21.8\% \\
DEAP & SAM-40 & 68.2\% & 67.5\% & $-$26.5\% \\
SAM-40 & EEGMAT & 78.6\% & 77.9\% & $-$14.6\% \\
EEGMAT & SAM-40 & 76.8\% & 76.1\% & $-$16.4\% \\
DEAP & EEGMAT & 74.2\% & 73.5\% & $-$20.5\% \\
EEGMAT & DEAP & 72.1\% & 71.4\% & $-$22.6\% \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\vspace{2mm}
\footnotesize{Cross-dataset transfer shows 14--27\% accuracy drops, indicating domain shift between stress paradigms.}
\end{table}

% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
% TABLE: Model Architecture (Table 3)
% -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
\begin{table}[htbp]
\centering
\caption{GenAI-RAG-EEG Model Architecture}
\label{tab:architecture}
\begin{tabular}{llr}
\toprule
\textbf{Component} & \textbf{Configuration} & \textbf{Params} \\
\midrule
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textit{EEG Encoder (138,081 params)}} \\
\quad Conv1D Layer 1 & 32 filters, kernel=7 & 7,200 \\
\quad Conv1D Layer 2 & 64 filters, kernel=5 & 10,304 \\
\quad Conv1D Layer 3 & 64 filters, kernel=3 & 12,352 \\
\quad Bi-LSTM & 64 hidden, 2 layers & 99,584 \\
\quad Self-Attention & 64 dim, 4 heads & 8,321 \\
\midrule
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textit{Text Encoder (49,152 params)}} \\
\quad Sentence-BERT & all-MiniLM-L6-v2 & 49,152 \\
\midrule
\multicolumn{3}{l}{\textit{Classifier (10,402 params)}} \\
\quad FC Layer 1 & 256 $\rightarrow$ 64 & 8,256 \\
\quad FC Layer 2 & 64 $\rightarrow$ 32 & 2,080 \\
\quad Output & 32 $\rightarrow$ 2 & 66 \\
\midrule
\textbf{Total} & & \textbf{197,635} \\
\bottomrule
\end{tabular}
\end{table}
